body:
### Problem

- The LSP server sends code actions list to Neovim client one of the code actions does not update the buffer (it's for ignoring the error)

- The code action sends the new diagnostics list using (textDocument/publishDiagnostics) to Neovim

- Now the UI does not change unless I update the buffer manually



https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/b19db9e5-10a8-41c6-bd15-044a4ad5e95d


adding this to `init.lua`
```lua 
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('DiagnosticChanged', {
    callback = function(args)
         vim.print(vim.inspect(args))
     end,
})
```  
it prints the up to date version of diagnostics

### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

```lua 
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('FileType', {
    pattern = {
        "markdown", "text", "plaintext", "md", "html", "xml", "json", "yaml", "toml", "javascript", "typescript",
        "javascriptreact", "typescriptreact", "css", "scss", "less", "vue", "svelte", "go", "python", "lua",
        "c", "cpp", "java", "php", "ruby", "rust", "bash", "sh", "dockerfile", "sql"
    },
    callback = function(args)
        vim.lsp.start({
            name = "cspell",
            cmd = { "node", "path/to/dist/server.js", "--stdio" },
            root_dir = vim.fn.getcwd(),
        })
    end,
})
```
1. run `nvim test.txt`
2. write `hellx` or any misspelled word
3. run `lua vim.lsp.buf.code_action()`
4. chose the last code action for adding the word to user settings

### Expected behavior

to update the UI of diagnostics without the need for updating the file

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.10.0 Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1713484068

### Language server name/version

custom made, https://github.com/salihdhaifullah/cspell-lsp

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04.4 LTS

### Log file

_No response_

comment_data.body:
> the problem is solved by setting is_pull to true in handle_diagnostics

Thanks for diagnosing that. This seems intentional: https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/25156

Is there anything actionable here?
is not updating the UI of diagnostics for a push notification intentional ? @justinmk

Looking at [diagnostic.lua](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/a0d8c2b86e788ce4273f0b8df258cd9e8e432d38/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/diagnostic.lua#L429)

It uses "LspNotify" auto command to register a callback for the server notifications, in this callback function it has this condition

```lua
        if
          opts.data.method ~= ms.textDocument_didChange
          and opts.data.method ~= ms.textDocument_didOpen
        then
          return
        end
```

If the document did not change it will not call the `_refresh` which refresh the ui I think

What do you think @justinmk
Thanks for narrowing that down. It does seem like that condition could be adjusted, it was part of the original impl in https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/24128. Maybe @catlee can comment also.

Hmmm....

keeping the push/pull diagnostics separate what somewhat by design (per the comment [here](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/pull/24128#discussion_r1239364111))

So when we get a push event from the server, they go into a separate namespace and get treated differently than the pull diagnostics for the same buffer.

Calling `_refresh` will trigger another request of pull diagnostics; it doesn't simply refresh the UI.

> is not updating the UI of diagnostics for a push notification intentional ? @justinmk

Push diagnostics should update the UI.

## The issue:

### when using two namespace push and pull to manage diagnostics updates a problem occurs because when the push namespace updates, it doesn't remove or update the outdated diagnostics from the pull namespace.

### the outdated diagnostics from the pull namespace remain active until the document is modified and reloaded, which triggers the diagnostics to refresh from the server using the pull namespace.

## Initial diagnostics:
**push:** `["error one", "error two"]`
**pull:** `["error one", "error two"]`

### After the server sends updated diagnostics the push namespace updates correctly
**push:** `["error two"]`

### but the pull namespace still holds the outdated information
**pull:** `["error one", "error two"]`

## testing using 
```lua
    local client_id = get_client_id(client_id)
    local pushOpts = {
        namespace = get_namespace(client_id, false)
    }

    local pullOpts = {
        namespace = get_namespace(client_id, true)
    }

    vim.print('\n\n - push namespace diagnostics')
    vim.print(vim.inspect(vim.diagnostic.get(bufnr, pushOpts)))
    vim.print('\n\n - pull namespace diagnostics')
    vim.print(vim.inspect(vim.diagnostic.get(bufnr, pullOpts)))
```

## result 
```js
 - push namespace diagnostics                                                                                                                                                                 
{}                                                                                                                                                                                            
 - pull namespace diagnostics                                                                                                                                                                 
{ {                                                                                                                                                                                           
    bufnr = 4,                                                                                                                                                                                
    col = 3,                                                                                                                                                                                  
    end_col = 9,                                                                                                                                                                              
    end_lnum = 211,                                                                                                                                                                           
    lnum = 211,                                                                                                                                                                               
    message = '"helloa": Unknown word.',                                                                                                                                                      
    namespace = 19,                                                                                                                                                                           
    severity = 2,                                                                                                                                                                             
    source = "cspell",                                                                                                                                                                        
    user_data = {                                                                                                                                                                             
      lsp = {                                                                                                                                                                                 
        data = {                                                                                                                                                                              
          suggestions = { "hella", "hello", "halloa", "hellos", "HELLO", "hellaao", "helga", "helot" },                                                                                       
          word = "helloa"                                                                                                                                                                     
        }                                                                                                                                                                                     
      }                                                                                                                                                                                       
    }                                                                                                                                                                                         
  } }  
```

is it possible to sync the push and pull diagnostic under certain conditions ?
or render the most recently updated namespace ?

For push diagnostics, the [spec](https://microsoft.github.io/language-server-protocol/specifications/lsp/3.17/specification/#textDocument_publishDiagnostics) says:
> When a file changes it is the server’s responsibility to re-compute diagnostics and push them to the client. If the computed set is empty it has to push the empty array to clear former diagnostics. Newly pushed diagnostics always replace previously pushed diagnostics. There is no merging that happens on the client side.
So it need to listen for publish diagnostics event and check if the diagnostics array is empty if so clear all the diagnostics from push and pull namespaces,  right ?

## code to reset the diagnostics
```lua
local function handle_diagnostics(uri, client_id, diagnostics, is_pull, config)
  client_id = get_client_id(client_id)
  -- reset all diagnostics for this LSP
  if is_pull ~= true and #diagnostics == 0 then
    local push_ns = M.get_namespace(client_id, false)
    local pull_ns = M.get_namespace(client_id, true)

    vim.diagnostic.reset(push_ns)
    vim.diagnostic.reset(pull_ns)

    return
  end

  local fname = vim.uri_to_fname(uri)

  if #diagnostics == 0 and vim.fn.bufexists(fname) == 0 then
    return
  end

  local bufnr = vim.fn.bufadd(fname)
  if not bufnr then
    return
  end

  local namespace = M.get_namespace(client_id, is_pull)

  if config then
    --- @cast config table<string, table>
    for _, opt in pairs(config) do
      convert_severity(opt)
    end
    -- Persist configuration to ensure buffer reloads use the same
    -- configuration. To make lsp.with configuration work (See :help
    -- lsp-handler-configuration)
    vim.diagnostic.config(config, namespace)
  end

  vim.diagnostic.set(namespace, bufnr, diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id))
end
```
